snippet: A judge sentenced an 84-year-old nun, Sister Megan Rice, on Tuesday to 35 months in prison for breaking into a facility where enriched uranium for nuclear bombs is stored.
abstract: Federal Judge Amul Thapar in Tennessee sentences 84-year-old nun Sister Megan Rice to 35 months in prison for breaking into Y-12 National Security Complex in Oak Ridge, facility where enriched uranium for nuclear bombs is stored; two others who took part in protest, Michael Walli and Greg Boertje-Obed, are sentenced to 62 months.
lead_paragraph: A judge sentenced an 84-year-old nun, Sister Megan Rice, on Tuesday to 35 months in prison for breaking into a facility where enriched uranium for nuclear bombs is stored.

headline.main: Tennessee: Nun Is Sentenced for Peace Protest
headline.print_headline: Tennessee: Nun Is Sentenced for Peace Protest
